reviewText: At the time of writing, the game is essentially unplayable as shipped, with the majority of players seemingly having the same issues. An additional codec is required for sound during movies, and an incredibly convoluted solution involving two third-party programs is required to actually be able to hear the music. None of these are integrated into the Steam installer, and the onus is on you to figure out how to get the game to run properly. This is not acceptable. It is Night Dive's responsibility to do that, not the consumer's. I suspect the only reason that the other Night Dive releases I played were free of major issues was because they were running in DOSBox and ScummVM (respectively), emulators licensed from competent programmers.\n\nPlease do not publish half-functional ports on Steam. Fix it or remove it from the store. If I wanted to struggle to get the game to run, I'd buy an original retail copy.
voteText: 18 of 21 people (86%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Recommended.  Give it a try.  IMPORTANT: install http://sourceforge.net/projects/ffdshow/ or you probably won't get audio.

In short, it's low-tech, a bit glitchy (quitting and restarting the game fixed a few dead-ended puzzles for me) and it inherits the lousy controls of its predecessors BUT the warm humour and story really shine through and more than make up for its age, linearity and shortcomings - you can see why this series has a cult following.

Tex is a great character - one of many - and in addition to the humour and cheese this is ALSO a genuinely interesting sci-fi mystery/detective story.

Ends on a big cliff-hanger, fortunately (finally) rectified by the excellent 2014 Tex game 'Tesla Effect'!

reviewText:
I am a recent fan of the Tex Murphy series, and am immediately hooked. I wanted to collect all the games immediately but I can't reccomend the purchase of this game.

I can't comment on the content or playability of the game, because the actual download itself is broken. If you are running a current gen system, this game will not work without multiple downloads of other programs to fix bugs and crashes. The developer has released a beta which he claims fixes some of the problems, but in actuality it now makes my game crash to the desktop upon launch.

Do not purchase this game.

If the Steam store had any conscience they would pull this title until a fully working copy could be created.

reviewText: This is the 5th Tex Murphy and the last Tex game that was made for 15 years before the reboot Tesla Effect. It is remake of the Mean Street so if you think the first Tex is too old" to play then you have the change to experience it with newer game mechanics. I myself enjoyed the original Mean Street so I was looking forward to see how good remake they did.\n\nIt's much like the Under the killing moon and Pandora Directive

the sequel to the Overseer.

There seems to have some problems to get the game working. I have tried this with Windows 7 and 10 and got it work on both. You need to install ffdshow to get the cutscenes to work and install MIDI emulator to get music to work. Just follow the guide: http://www.gog.com/forum/tex_murphy_series/got_overseer_dvdversion_working_wonderfully_with_quality_81x64_midi_outputfinally
Even after these fixes on the Windows 10 the game might crash on some puzzles
column21: I didn't find any fix for that other then transferring the saves to my Windows 7 machine where the game seems to be more stable and didn't crash on anything.\n\nSo aside the technical problems on modern systems the game is excellent FMV game which I can recommend to anyone who likes filmnoire and detective stories."

reviewText:
I initially gave this game a poor review due to technical bugs. I encountered an error that asked me to insert a disk in order to play, obviously this wasn't possible.

This was caused by installing the game on a computer that did not have an optical drive. With the help of Night Dive, I installed a virtual drive and the game ran fine.

I haven't encountered any of the other problems people have mentioned, so I can only assume that they have been fixed, or are simply isolated issues, or I just lucked out.

With all of that said, Tex Murphy is an acquired taste. Humorous, post-apocalyptic, detective, noir, FMV, et cetera. If you are thinking of buying this, you are probably already familiar with the series. If you are not familiar with the series, you might want to start with some of the earlier entries (but you should probably avoid the first game).

reviewText: I literally can't play it!  I've had to reset my computer at least three times, because the game crashes every five minutes and I did time it.  How is a person suppose to enjoy this game if the game keeps crashing like that!

I think i reached my limit in this game. I keep getting error messages as i am at Gideons house using the poles to try and get across the pressure sensitive floor. As a kid i played this game and would get stuck all the time because we didnt have a strategy guide online to follow like i do now. Makes it a lot easier but it is also a clear MUST if your going to play this game. Anyone thats says its cheating and they never used it is a liar OR they spent YEARS trying to beat this game. If they can fix the game i will finish it. As of now i am S.O.L. !
